intro: Andromeda elliptica, commonly known as the narrowleaf wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, moist soils and thrives in shaded to partially sunny environments. Its leaves are elliptical in shape, with a glossy dark green surface, and its flowers range in color from white to pink, blooming in late winter to early spring. The plant is also valued for its aromatic oils, which have been used in traditional medicine.
